active_learning.discussion_prompt: In light of recent supply chain attacks like SolarWinds or Log4j, debate the effectiveness of current component identification methods (e.g., PURL vs. CPE). What gaps exist in SBOM adoption, and how can organizations enforce better transparency? Support your arguments with CISA/NTIA standards.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, and scaffolding. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Component Identification Methods' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) > Software Supply Chain Security > Component Verification Standards > Component Identification Methods). Base content on completed research context: Core concepts (Component, SBOM, C-SCRM); Full SBOM attributes per CISA/NTIA (Component Name, Supplier Name, Version, Unique Identifier like PURL/CPE/SWID/SPDX ID, Type, Hashes, Relationships, License, Copyright, Description, End-of-Life); Formats (SPDX, CycloneDX); Tools (Syft, Dependency-Track); Sources (CISA SBOM Framing: https://www.cisa.gov/sites/default/files/2024-10/SBOM%20Framing%20Software%20Component%20Transparency%202024.pdf; NIST SP 800-161; NTIA SBOM Minimum Elements). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list from above] - Active Learning: Tie flashcards to discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving (e.g., 'Use in debate on SolarWinds'). - Scaffolding: Distribute cards across 4 layers (12-13 per layer): Foundation (recall basics), Components (attributes/methods), Implementation (tools/steps), Integration (risk/policy links). - Prior knowledge: Link to package managers (npm/Maven), basic risks. Use Flashcard Schema: - Output as JSON array: [{'front': 'Question', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'layer': '1', 'blooms_level': 'REMEMBER', 'references': ['CISA'], 'activity_tie_in': '...'}}, ...] - 40% multiple-choice (1 correct + 3 distractors per protocol), 30% short-answer/cloze, 30% scenario-based (apply/analyze/eval/create). - Ensure completeness: Every card covers voter priorities (full attributes, comparisons). - Progressive difficulty: Early cards REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND, later EVALUATE/CREATE. Generate now.
